column5:
Add validations after init (#525)

* When stateChanged is triggered before variable change it cause infinit loop, after closing popup window

* Need to run same checks after init, like is running after adding and removing components, otherwise stack has different behavior after init and after adding new component
Infinite loop when closing popup window if stateChanged is triggered before variable change (#524)

Remove the postinstall step that deleted *.info files. (#495)

I tried to track down why this was initially implemented, and it appears to have first been included when changing to WebPack with commit: 334c94da502395b224babcf89bb6cb8c27c5f445

Ran the various npm start/build commands to make sure nothing was broken:
`npm run start`
`npm run build`
`npm run start_es6j`
`npm run build_es6j`
`npm run start_es6z`
`npm run build_es6z`
added removeDragSource() method to layout manager (#338)

Update ISSUE_TEMPLATE.MD (#488)

Updated codepen to be forkable

fix contentItem type declaration (#512)

(add container property)

Update Typo in Tab.html (#510)

fix contentItem spelling
Fixing Incorrect activeItemIndex after removing siblings (#509)

Properly calculate root item areas (#457)

* Properly calculate root item areas

Update layout manager to properly calculate root item areas when the layout origin is not (0,0). 

Currently if a dashboard is not positioned at or near 0,0 in the document, the left and top root drag areas do not work.  This fixes that by adding in the current x and y offset to the root areas when appropriate.

* Removed unused variable

* Update ES6 version as well

* Fix formatting/tab/spaces

Save header position changes to parents config (#474)

Header position isn't being saved toConfig when set programatically
clear LayoutManager._maximisedItem when the maximised item is destroyed (#469)

Fix destroy (#485)

* Proposed fix for #484 - Deeply nested layouts have extremely poor performance when destroyed

* fix comment

closes #435. Tests are restored. Only 1 test working as example. The rest must be updated to reflect ES6 changes and work with the new Jasmine version.

Merge pull request #428 from golden-layout/dev

modernize
transform to ES6 (first pass, not part of the build process yet)

removed the wrap stage from the `build` task in the gulp file

Removed the wrap stage from the `build` task in the gulp file because
the changes from 277b8a167b5f59c9b3cb568741e0b2508a51dcbc remove the
need for it.
added react and react-dom as optional dependencies

switched to using ref to get result of ReactDOM.render

Switched to using a ref to get the result of `ReactDOM.render` because of a bug
where `ReactDOM.render` would return `null` if it was called mid-render.

added require calls for Webpack support.

Adding a declared module called golden-layout to index.d.ts

Cleaning up formatting and adding back export = GoldenLayout

In use, the export = GoldenLayout is needed to be able to use the class GoldenLayout and the exports in the namespace GoldenLayout separately.

Emit activeContentItemChanged event on layoutManager as well.
This makes it easier to listen to these events without having to
manage separate listeners for each component.
Take border/padding of component into account when calculating size.

Adding a declared module called golden-layout

To import external modules a module needs to be declared.

Stopped errors when no event is present

Because of the jQuery calling nature of GoldenLayout you always expect an event. But when a user calls toggleMaximise from their code it may not be appropriate to pass any event and therefore no need to prevent any default action.
Mappings change (hopefully this doesn't happen every build)
Merge branch 'less-themes' of https://github.com/ldetomi/golden-layout into ldetomi-less-themes

Merge pull request #232 from uklimaschewski/master

Do not update size of hidden components to prevent unwanted reflows

Do not update size of hidden components to prevent unwanted reflows

Open/Close tab performance on Firefox will dramatically decrease with complex hidden HTML. This change seems not to have any visible side effects.
Generated LESS version also for remaining Themes
Merge branch 'less-themes' of https://github.com/ldetomi/golden-layout into ldetomi-less-themes

Create ISSUE_TEMPLATE.MD

Added a template for issues
Aligned LESS code and generated CSS to last commits by other users about Responsive dropdown arrows and other minors

Merge pull request #225 from LarissaSmith/master

Improve touch support

Improve touch support:
Splitters/header controls should work.
Dragging tabs is possible, though it requires two touches.

Merge pull request #223 from e9gille/patch-1

Fix delta calculation on setSize

fix delta calculation on setSize

The delta calculation for distributing size across remaining items is incorrectly including the resized item as well.

Merge pull request #211 from greggbjensen/responsive-design

Added responsive design for width with columns

Implemented responsiveMode with onload, always, and none as the values

Implemented new responsiveMode in config.settings that defaults to
onload so that the columns are only stacked on page load.  The always
responsive mode will stack columns while it is resized as well.  The
none responsive mode will not stack columns.
Added LESS version of Main CSS files (Light, Dark Themes and Base). Added also comments inside them to help users better understand role of each css class

Fixed dimensions minItemWidth not enforced on window resize

Implemented fix to enforce minItemWidth as window is resized, by taking
width from columns that are over proportionately.

You can review the change by going to the Responsive Layout page and
then watching the name textbox as you resize and it will always show the
full width.

Set responsive to true by default.  Implemented fix to always show at
least one tab in visible header.

Drop down tab styling

Increased z-index to 5 to prevent conflicting with any elements in the panel with z-index:1 as default
Hide overflow on dropdown list in case title is too long.
Remove margin to hide empty space

Invert tab dropdown arrow for light theme.

Other themes are fine with the white color.

Merge pull request #212 from greggbjensen/tab-dropdown

Added dropdown arrow for additional tabs when too many to be displayed

Merge remote-tracking branch 'refs/remotes/origin/tab-dropdown'

# Conflicts:
#	dist/goldenlayout.min.js
#	index.html
#	start.js
#	test.css

Added dropdown arrow for additional tabs when too many to be displayed

Automatically shows or hides a dropdown arrow in header controls that
shows all additional tabs that would not fit in the header for display.

Added responsive design for width with columns.

Added new settings.responsive property to the config.  When this is set
and the minItemWidth does not allow all columns to fit on the page, it
moves the rightmost column into the first Stack, until the minItemWidth
is respected.

Returned the created Drag Source (issue #167) and destroyed the Drag …
Drag sources are initialized in the constructor as an empty list, so that made possible to remove the if-s for checking when destroying the layout manager or when creating a new Drag Source.
Returned the created Drag Source (issue #167) and destroyed the Drag Listeners when the Layout Manager is destroyed (issue #84).

Merge pull request #89 from evansb/fix-#87

Handles React component in createContentItem

React.ComponentWillUpdate() method is called with the wrong 'this' argument

The original 'this' argument should also be used when calling
"_originalComponentWillUpdate()".

Revert "React.ComponentWillUpdate() method is called with the wrong 'this' argument."

This reverts commit 9d2c96b5a51eca58888d3859da39de22a00b5d71.

React.ComponentWillUpdate() method is called with the wrong 'this' argument.

The original 'this' argument should also be used when calling
"_originalComponentWillUpdate()".

Fixed stack overflow due to React props

Do not recursively search React props--it can easily lead to a stack
overflow: Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded.

Merge pull request #48 from csterritt/master

Added 'beforeItemDestroyed' event. (Many thanks for this)

Don't force box-sizing

Only apply box-sizing property for GL's own classes. Don't force it to all inner elements.
Updated package.json's jspm entry to latest recommended format.
fix(stack): make stack unclosable when it has a non closable component.

fix(container): allow setSize to work with widths and heights

Currently the `setSize` method on containers only works with heights but
accepts 2 parameter `width, height`. If the container is part of a row
the width is used to resize the widths of all content items. If the
container is part of a column the height is used to resize the height of
all content items.

fix(package): fix package.json trailing commas.

npm fails to install dependencies when there are trailing commas at the last item of arrays.
Changed url parameter passing to localStorage
Fix height of drag target indicator for tab when the tab has padding
set reorderEnabled on an item level #13
Don't close tab with middle click if isClosable is false
Middle mouse button click closes tab
Added support for html in titles
Moved xssFilter from layoutManager to utils and added __lm
Removed non-dev dependencies and added filemap for cdnjs
Decreased tab font size to 12px for dark theme
Updated package.json for publishing to npm
